characters.description: Ben Urich is a reporter for the Daily Bugle who has many ties to the city's superhero community.

characters.name: Venom (Mac Gargan)
characters.description: One of Spider-Man's oldest enemies, Mac Gargan has recently abandoned his Scorpion suit and identity and bonded with the alien symbiote that had previously been hosted by Peter Parker and Eddie Brock, becoming the new Venom.

characters.name: Scorpion (Carmilla Black)
characters.description: Carmilla Black is a genetically engineered human, created by Advanced Idea Mechanics (A.I.M.).

characters.name: Sub-Mariner
characters.description: Prince Namor is the half-human/half-Atlantean ruler of Atlantis.

characters.name: Thor Girl
characters.description: Tarene, aware of her true nature as the Designate, a being foretold to elevate all life to greatness, sought adventure and, using Thor as a template, transformed herself into an Asgardian goddess and journeyed to Earth.

characters.name: Trauma
characters.description: Terrance Ward was drafted into the Initiative training program because of his telepathic and shape-shifting abilities.

characters.name: Triathlon
characters.description: After being exposed as a steroid user and stripped of his awards, gifted sprinter Delroy Garrett Jr. sought new direction in the Triune Understanding, a philosophical movement that preaches the fulfillment of one's innate potential by balancing various aspects of environment and self, after which he developed a superhuman triple-powered physique, and, believing the Triune teachings had unlocked his latent powers, Garrett became the costumed hero Triathlon and celebrity spokesman for the Triune Understanding.

characters.name: Stature
characters.description: Cassie Lang is the daughter of deceased Avenger Scott Lang and a member of the Young Avengers.

characters.name: Speed
characters.description: Tommy Shepherd may be the son of the Scarlet Witch and the Vision, and thus the twin brother of Wiccan.

characters.name: White Tiger (Angela Del Toro)
characters.description: Federal agent Angela Del Toro is the heir to a heroic legacy that began with the Jade Tiger, a long-lost enchanted statue from the fabled kingdom of K'un-Lun, and had been last held by her uncle, Hector Ayala, who fought alongside such heroes as Daredevil and Spider-Man.

characters.name: Squirrel Girl
characters.description: Escaping the taunts of her fellow school students regarding her physical mutation, Los-Angeles born Doreen Green fled into the nearby woods where she quickly discovered her affinity for squirrels.

characters.name: Deathlok
Swordsman (Jaques Duquesne)
characters.description: When Clint Barton came to the Carson Carnival of Traveling Wonders, the Swordsman became one of his mentors.

characters.name: Yellowjacket (Rita DeMara)
characters.description: Rita DeMara, hoping to show off her talent of engineering, stole a copy of the Yellowjacket costume from the Avengers Mansion.

characters.name: Wind Dancer
characters.description: Given the codename Wind Dancer, Sofia Mantega stepped up to lead the New Mutants.

characters.name: Strong Guy
characters.description: According to his own admission, Guido was a nerdy-looking kid in his early life, bullied by other children, but after he discovered his mutant ability at a young age, when he was struck by a school bus, no one bullied him again.

characters.name: Slapstick
characters.description: Steven Harmon's powers have been described as "all of the abilities of a Saturday morning cartoon character."

characters.name: Starfox
characters.description: The youngest son of Mentor and Sui-San, Eros had the natural ability to excite pleasure in others, but his power had no effect upon his mutant older brother, Thanos, who worshiped the cosmic embodiment of Death and led an army against Titan.

characters.name: Jimmy Woo
characters.description: Jimmy Woo is a former FBI and SHIELD agent from the '50s who now leads the Agents of Atlas in the present.

characters.name: Venus (Siren)
characters.description: During her time as an adventurer, Venus was approached by FBI agent Jimmy Woo, and she agreed to join Jimmy and his allies in freeing President Eisenhower from the clutches of the Yellow Claw.

characters.name: Bob, Agent of Hydra
characters.description: A cowardly young man, Bob was persuaded into joining the criminal organization HYDRA and has had numerous encounters with Deadpool and other Marvel heroes.

characters.name: Scrambler
characters.description: Korean national Kim Il Sung was the youngest member of the Marauders, the superhuman assassins responsible for massacring the underground mutant community known as the Morlocks.

characters.name: Warlock (Technarchy)
characters.description: The New Mutants' Warlock is an alien being from an unidentified world where the a sentient life forms are "techno-organic" life that resembles circuitry and machinery in various ways.

characters.name: Guardians of the Galaxy
characters.description: A group of cosmic adventurers brought together by Star-Lord, the  Guardians of the Galaxy protect the universe from threats all  across space. The team also includes Drax, Gamora, Groot and Rocket  Raccoon!

characters.name: Thundra
characters.description: Thundra was quite possibly her world's greatest female specimens, and as she won countless battles against the men, she was revered as the Sisterhood's greatest hero.

characters.name: Toro (Thomas Raymond)
characters.description: As the Torch approached Toro, his presence caused Toro to burst into flame like the Torch himself, but while remaining unharmed, causing the Torch to realize that Toro had the same powers that he himself did.

characters.name: Tinkerer
characters.description: The Tinkerer is an ordinary man who has an extraordinary talent for anything mechanical.

characters.name: Spider-Man (Miles Morales)
characters.description: Teenager Miles Morales grew up in Brooklyn, New York. Recently, Miles took on the controversial and pressured role of Spider-Man shortly after the death of the original. Morales made his debut against The Kangaroo, much to the surprise and disapproval of many present at the confrontation.

characters.name: Captain America (Sam Wilson)
characters.description: Sam Wilson, a Harlem native, previously operated under the name Falcon, fighting alongside the Avengers. When his longtime friend Steve Rogers stepped down as Captain America, Wilson was hand-picked to fill the role. Now the former Falcon soars through the skies wearing red, white and blue.

characters.name: Thor (Goddess of Thunder)
characters.description: When the Odinson lost his ability to wield Mjolnir, the role of Thor, God of Thunder, was left unoccupied…albeit for a short time. A mysterious female figure picked up the hammer with ease, changing the inscription to fit her status as the Goddess of Thunder.

characters.name: Ms. Marvel (Kamala Khan)
characters.description: A Muslim-American teenager growing up in Jersey City, Kamala Khan gained shape-shifting powers when Inhumanity spread over the Earth. A fan of super heroes, in particular Carol Danvers, Kamala took up Captain Marvel's former identity, becoming the new Ms. Marvel. This up and coming hero works to protect her community and understand her place in the world.
